com.github.mangstadt.vinnie.validate

Class VObjectValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mangstadt.vinnie.validate.VObjectValidator

  • public class VObjectValidator
extends Object

    Checks properties for illegal characters.

    Two kinds of checking are supported: strict and non-strict. Strict ensures that the data adhere to the specifications. Non-strict allows all characters to be used, as long as they do not break the syntax.

    Example: 

     SyntaxStyle style = SyntaxStyle.NEW;
 String name = "NOTE #2";
 
 boolean strict = false;
 assertTrue(VObjectValidator.validatePropertyName(name, style, strict));
 
 strict = true;
 assertFalse(VObjectValidator.validatePropertyName(name, style, strict));
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt

    • Method Detail

      • validatePropertyName

        public static boolean validatePropertyName(String name,
                                           SyntaxStyle syntax,
                                           boolean strict)
        Validates a property name.
        Parameters:
        name - the property name
        syntax - the syntax style to validate against
        strict - false to allow all characters as long as they don't break the syntax, true for spec-compliant validation
        Returns:
        true if the property name is valid, false if not

      • allowedCharactersPropertyName

        public static AllowedCharacters allowedCharactersPropertyName(SyntaxStyle syntax,
                                                              boolean strict)
        Gets the list of allowed characters for property names.
        Parameters:
        syntax - the syntax style
        strict - false for the non-strict list, true for the spec-compliant list
        Returns:
        the character list

        Validates a parameter value.
        Parameters:
        value - the parameter value
        syntax - the syntax style to validate against
        caretEncoding - true if caret encoding is enabled, false if not
        strict - false to allow all characters as long as they don't break the syntax, true for spec-compliant validation
        Returns:
        true if the parameter value is valid, false if not
